channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: From @WSJopinion: The GOP still has the ability to restore its reputation on spending, but it needed to start yesterday, writes @KimStrassel. A good first step would be saying no to any form of Chuck Schumer’s corporate-welfare blowout. https://t.co/IsKlnlcrqe
Russia’s military and economic alliances across Central Asia are looking shakier after its invasion of Ukraine. “Are we going to be next?” https://t.co/QySGy8VdeT
Tesla is bidding for public dollars to build electric-vehicle chargers, a move that would start to open some of its network to non-Tesla drivers https://t.co/eqDlJc5ATC
Monkeypox is now a global health emergency, the WHO said. There are more than 16,000 cases across dozens of countries. https://t.co/Q1o2mFnlGp
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/aBJf3d30Iy

Washington risks relying excessively on the Fed to lower inflation by reducing demand, rather than have other policy makers work to increase the economy’s capacity to supply more goods and services or workers https://t.co/wVAxlmGZ6x
President Biden’s symptoms are improving three days after he tested positive for Covid-19, one of his advisers and his doctor said Sunday https://t.co/t0VUH3im7L
Toronto’s Pearson International has won top honors for airport service for years, but now it's at the epicenter of a global air-travel meltdown https://t.co/uDv3FlDlIl
Elon Musk's alleged brief affair with the wife of Google co-founder Sergey Brin led to the couple's divorce filing https://t.co/ne5vsdnEVf
FedEx says packages previously sorted for Sunday delivery will be moved to Saturday and Monday. https://t.co/74tp8qG4qp
Natalie Portman's jacked shoulders and arms in "Thor: Love and Thunder" show this summer’s new beauty standard https://t.co/SQIvNIsXBz
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal leaped last year. Here's why so many Americans are relocating there. https://t.co/Vg4LTQwjbd

Turkey’s low-cost drones helped alter the balance of power in Ukraine’s battle against the Russian invasion, as a two-decade-long project to become a weapons-manufacturing powerhouse is starting to pay off https://t.co/d56tFbyC0u
Muslims in India say authorities are demolishing their homes following protests and sectarian clashes. https://t.co/zUqyYTVswM
Saudi Arabia plans to construct two parallel buildings up to 1,600 feet tall and stretching for 75 miles across mountains and desert https://t.co/cbKE04RpH9
The U.S. Forest Service has unveiled an emergency plan to try to save giant sequoias from the threat of wildfires https://t.co/bJDbBcQEI7
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/EQLOBu5YoT
France’s biggest oil company is discounting gas at its service stations across the country amid pressure from the government. https://t.co/03LrjZcm7N

Large numbers of fin whales—the second-largest animal species on Earth after blue whales—have returned to their ancestral feeding areas near Antarctica for the first time in decades, scientists said https://t.co/p5RASKxkJd
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/uk4gNlPUli
Looking for a DIY project? Try making your own coffin. “We just had so much fun.” https://t.co/DFQSxlPk6z
Saudi Arabia plans to construct two parallel buildings up to 1,600 feet tall and stretching for 75 miles across mountains and desert https://t.co/qZJZK5jZTv
Monkeypox is now a global health emergency, the WHO said. There are more than 16,000 cases across dozens of countries. https://t.co/iEtzPTXLow

From @WSJopinion: Democrats aren’t suddenly alarmed by the discovery of unexpected evidence that Biden is too old for the job. They are alarmed by the discovery of entirely predictable evidence that he is too inept for the job, writes @gerardtbaker. https://t.co/QtJtZLMx9k

Russian President Vladimir Putin can afford to cut off natural-gas exports to Europe in the short term, but any loss of gas revenue from the region in years to come will be hard to replace https://t.co/Ac9eShK6hM

Intense heat and dry conditions are threatening corn, soybeans and other crops as well as cattle herds, just as some commodity prices have eased amid concerns about global food supplies https://t.co/H5gdM0sZFk
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/gxm5vTLEtv https://t.co/ZAfQZ0TmaM
Russia launched a missile attack on the key Ukrainian port of Odessa hours after signing a deal to unblock grain exports via the Black Sea https://t.co/6T68ezVgrp

The Biden administration has so far held off on approving a Ukrainian request for long-range armed drones, concerned that the aircraft and its highly-sensitive technology could wind up in Russian hands if Ukrainian forces are overwhelmed https://t.co/SXELgwByIa
“They will not use this pause to change their geopolitics.” Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky spoke to WSJ about what it would take for a cease-fire with Russia. https://t.co/OrrwXnrqDG

California’s governor is digging in as businesses warn they are starting to feel the pain of a trucker blockade at the Port of Oakland. “If this carries on, I don’t know what we are going to do.” https://t.co/dOzuRTlQR8

Google fired an engineer who contended that an artificial-intelligence chatbot the company developed had become sentient, telling him that he had violated the company’s confidentiality policy after it dismissed his claims https://t.co/pDdYGBhlk5

“I don’t want to say the election is over,” then-President Trump said in outtakes from remarks filmed the day after the Capitol riot. “I just want to say Congress has certified the results without saying the election is over, okay?” https://t.co/8AdD76C3Pf
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has unnerved the Biden administration with the possibility of a trip to Taiwan after China warned that the visit would trigger severe consequences https://t.co/DcCrv5R9sK
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/hq9tpW9pTb https://t.co/jMnGclQDaK

The biggest problem for the U.S. housing market is that there aren’t enough homes available. The sales slowdown probably won’t do much to alleviate the situation and over time could make it even worse https://t.co/AhpnFlkmmO

Google fired an engineer who contended that an artificial-intelligence chatbot the company developed had become sentient, telling him that he had violated the company’s confidentiality policy after it dismissed his claims https://t.co/NRvtebFwAB
Breaking: Vince McMahon is retiring as chief executive of WWE. The announcement comes after the company disclosed an investigation into his alleged sexual misconduct. https://t.co/tVMsfI3Trq

Breaking: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon was found guilty in his contempt of Congress trial for refusing to comply with a subpoena issued by the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack https://t.co/8VImtKqI07

Soon after the Uvalde gunman crashed his car outside Robb Elementary School in late May, teachers and staff received an alert advising them to lock down the school. It was the 47th such alert that schools in Uvalde had received since late February. https://t.co/eu8OvaB8D2 https://t.co/zHjn5OEqdU

From @WSJopinion: If the elite continues pushing incredibly expensive climate policies that are disconnected from the urgent challenges facing most people, we need to brace for chaos, writes @BjornLomborg https://t.co/X3Ihan3bKy
A man climbed onto a stage and attempted to stab U.S, Rep. Lee Zeldin, the latest act of violence against a political figure https://t.co/m8qAKFdlXW

Turkey’s low-cost drones helped alter the balance of power in Ukraine’s battle against the Russian invasion, as a two-decade-long project to become a weapons-manufacturing powerhouse is starting to pay off https://t.co/5sN6NQWGSH

Mark Meadows, then-President Trump’s chief of staff, was flooded with text messages on Jan. 6 urging him to get the president to make a statement denouncing the riot: "He's got to condemn this s--- ASAP," Donald Trump Jr. texted. https://t.co/Z5Wa7jBU6r
"There was no ambiguity, no nuance. Donald Trump made a purposeful choice to violate his oath of office," Rep. Liz Cheney said in closing Thursday's Jan. 6 committee hearing. https://t.co/vybyRPtG5g

"Everything he said about supporting law enforcement was a lie.” Texts between former Trump aides showed outrage over the president ignoring news of Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick's death. https://t.co/xsNaZVd3oC

An unnamed White House security official described harrowing radio messages from Vice President Mike Pence’s security detail during the Capitol attack, telling the Jan. 6 committee that some members radioed in goodbyes to their family members https://t.co/eiRYgoMwNc

Jan. 6 committee member Rep. Adam Kinzinger recounted testimony from an unnamed White House employee about a conversation with Trump on the evening of the Capitol attack: “Mike Pence let me down,” Trump allegedly said. https://t.co/3aTa18X0rS

Rep. Liz Cheney said the House select committee investigating the Capitol attack will hold more hearings in September: "Doors have opened, new subpoenas have been issued and the dam has begun to break." https://t.co/lCpu6DV9GE

The Jan. 6 committee showed security footage of Sen. Josh Hawley–who had earlier in the day raised a fist in solidarity with Trump supporters—running down the halls of the Capitol in an apparent attempt to escape the rioters https://t.co/rVxDsWhjBN
